summary: Completed visual QA testing of Nordic Theme Contrast / Form Readability fix across JarlPM app. All form controls (Input, Textarea, Select) now have proper contrast in both light and dark modes. Focus states are visible with ring-2 ring-ring/30 styling. Theme toggle works correctly.

frontend: Login page - form inputs readable in light mode (bg: rgb(243, 245, 247), text: rgb(32, 41, 50))
Login page - form inputs readable in dark mode (bg: rgb(17, 22, 29), text: rgb(229, 231, 235))
Signup page - all 4 inputs readable in light mode
Signup page - all 4 inputs readable in dark mode
Settings page (LLM tab) - inputs and selects readable in light mode
Settings page (LLM tab) - inputs and selects readable in dark mode
Settings page (Delivery Context tab) - all 6 inputs readable in both themes
New Initiative page - input and textarea readable in light mode
New Initiative page - input and textarea readable in dark mode
Dashboard - Quick Start input readable in light mode
Dashboard - Quick Start input readable in dark mode
Landing page - proper contrast in light mode (hero text: rgb(32, 41, 50))
Landing page - proper contrast in dark mode (hero text: rgb(229, 231, 235))
Theme toggle works correctly - switches between light/dark classes
Focus states visible on form controls (ring-2 ring-ring/30 styling)
Placeholder text visible in both themes (muted-foreground color)
Select dropdown menus readable with proper backgrounds in both themes

critical_code_review_comments: Input component correctly uses bg-background text-foreground instead of bg-transparent
Textarea component correctly uses bg-background text-foreground
Focus ring styling (ring-2 ring-ring/30 focus-visible:border-primary/40) is working correctly
CSS variables properly defined for both :root (light) and .dark themes
Nordic color aliases added to tailwind.config.js for legacy component support
